page.title: 08Employment of Sydling People
page.content: About 80 people of the village are in paid employment. The most prominent occupations are in the professional or scientific services and in agriculture. Most people drive them- selves to work. There are 15 self employed people in the village and most work in Sydling or in close proximity. Most people agree that there should be more jobs available in the village. Suggested employment includes rural crafts such as hedge laying, thatching, plumbing, decorating, carpentry, pottery, furniture making, gardening and motor maintenance. It was also felt that there should be no concentration of buildings for industry, rather workshops using small amounts of land suitable for individual craftsmen.
